QuestionStem: Each kidney contains more than 1 million filtering structures called nephrons. The nephron is made up of cells that work together. Based on the information, which statement is true?

options.AnswerText: A. The nephron can be defined as an organ.
options.Feedback: Does the information in the question text provide evidence that the nephron is an organ?

options.AnswerText: B. The kidney is an organ system.
options.Feedback: Organ systems are made up of two or more organs working together.

options.AnswerText: C. The nephron can be defined as an organ system.
options.Feedback: Organ systems are made up of two or more organs working together.

options.AnswerText: D. The nephron can be defined as a tissue.
options.Feedback: Think about which level of organization is made up of several different tissue types.

FinalIncorrectFeedback: The nephron is a group of cells that perform a function within an organ, so it would be considered a tissue.
